text: Reactive oxygen intermediate - dependent NF-kappaB activation by <extra_id_0> interleukin-1beta <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> requires <extra_id_0> 5-lipoxygenase <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> or NADPH oxidase activity .
We previously reported that the role of reactive oxygen intermediates ( ROIs ) in NF-kappaB activation by proinflammatory cytokines was cell specific .

However , the sources for ROIs in various cell types are yet to be determined and might include <extra_id_0> 5-lipoxygenase <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> ( <extra_id_0> 5-LOX <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> ) and NADPH oxidase .

<extra_id_0> 5-LOX <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> and <extra_id_0> 5-LOX <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> activating protein ( <extra_id_0> FLAP <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> ) are coexpressed in lymphoid cells but not in monocytic or epithelial cells .

text: Stimulation of lymphoid cells with <extra_id_0> interleukin-1beta <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> ( <extra_id_0> IL-1beta <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> ) led to ROI production and NF-kappaB activation , which could both be blocked by antioxidants or <extra_id_0> FLAP <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> inhibitors , confirming that <extra_id_0> 5-LOX <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> was the source of ROIs and was required for NF-kappaB activation in these cells .

<extra_id_0> IL-1beta <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> stimulation of epithelial cells did not generate any ROIs and NF-kappaB induction was not influenced by <extra_id_0> 5-LOX <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> inhibitors .

However , reintroduction of a functional <extra_id_0> 5-LOX <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> system in these cells allowed ROI production and <extra_id_0> 5-LOX <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> - dependent NF-kappaB activation .

In monocytic cells , <extra_id_0> IL-1beta <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> treatment led to a production of ROIs which is independent of the <extra_id_0> 5-LOX <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> enzyme but requires the NADPH oxidase activity .

This pathway involves the <extra_id_0> Rac1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> and <extra_id_0> Cdc42 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> GTPases , two enzymes which are not required for NF-kappaB activation by <extra_id_0> IL-1beta <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> in epithelial cells .

In conclusion , three different cell - specific pathways lead to NF-kappaB activation by <extra_id_0> IL-1beta <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> : a pathway dependent on ROI production by <extra_id_0> 5-LOX <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> in lymphoid cells , an ROI - and <extra_id_0> 5-LOX <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> - independent pathway in epithelial cells , and a pathway requiring ROI production by NADPH oxidase in monocytic cells .
